title: Honey Glazed Chicken Recipe
description: Delicious honey chicken made with pan-fried chicken breast cubes glazed with a sticky-sweet sauce of honey, soy sauce, and red pepper flakes.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Meat and Poultry Chicken Chicken Breast Honey Glazed Chicken 4.6 (558) 437 Reviews 202 Photos This honey chicken dish is easy to make with just 5 ingredients. I've used this recipe for years, and my family requests it often. Delicious served on steamed rice and garnished with sliced green onions. Submitted by jbrink1 Updated on August 21, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 202 202 202 202 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ¼ cup honey 2 tablespoons soy sauce ⅛ teaspoon red pepper flakes 1 ½ tablespoons olive oil 2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into bite-size pieces Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk honey, soy sauce, and red pepper flakes in a bowl; set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir chicken in hot oil until lightly brown, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour honey mixture into the skillet; continue to cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink in the center and sauce is thickened, about 5 minutes more. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve hot and enjoy! Adam Vaccarezza I Made It Print 2,936 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 179 Calories 7g Fat 18g Carbs 13g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 179 % Daily Value * Total Fat 7g 8% Saturated Fat 1g 6% Cholesterol 34mg 11% Sodium 481mg 21% Total Carbohydrate 18g 7% Dietary Fiber 0g 0% Total Sugars 18g Protein 13g 26% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 9mg 1% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 131mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. Add Your Photo Photos of Honey Glazed Chicken 01 of 202 Photo by  Adam Vaccarezza 02 of 202 Photo by  Nicole Pinto 01/28/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite 03 of 202 Photo by  Absedp 08/26/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Great flavors The recipe is easy to follow and taste is delicious.I made the following two changes in the recipe:1. Marinated chicken with oil and McCormic's Montreal Chicken Seasoning for 2 hours before cooking.2. I prepared rice and mixed it with the finished cooking. 04 of 202 Photo by  Patty 05/19/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite I added some broccoli and zucchini with the cooked chicken. Using over 2 lbs of cooked chicken, I tripled the sauce amount and added 3 tablespoons of cornstarch. Added some sesame seeds and served with white rice. DELICIOUS! 05 of 202 Photo by  LilacMixer8385 02/28/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Family favorite Awesome! I doubled the recipe and used No Soy sauce (soy allergy in the house) and it tasted fantastic. Added a bit of rosemary and that really brought out the flavor. Great & simple recipe, and easy to adjust for individual taste! 06 of 202 Photo by  CozyChive5715 12/27/2023 I really loved it, I already cooked this for 2nd time's now it's really like sweet and spicy I loved it, also my family loved it💗 07 of 202 Photo by  PuffyTongs9519 12/01/2023 Delish! Zero changes to the recipe. Runny sauce? Nope! Turned the heat a little higher towards the end and let the chicken drown in the thickening sauce. Basted along the way. Really good. 08 of 202 Photo by  ToastyJelly7868 08/19/2023 I made it and everyone loved it. I’m not sure why but the glaze never thickened but I think that’s something I did when I doubled the recipe. 09 of 202 Photo by  Nichole's Menu 06/23/2023 Sauce was thin and watery. Not sure why the picture made it look dark and thick. Not very flavorful but pretty good and it didn’t take long to make so a huge pluslong to make 10 of 202 Photo by  SnappyClove7059 01/28/2023 It’s AMAZING, I honestly wasn’t sure if I was going to be able to make it right but i did it. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Garam Masala Chicken 24 Ratings Simple Lemon Chicken 19 Ratings BBQ Chicken Pouches 5 Ratings Quick Meal-Prep Chicken 1 Rating Sharyl's Spicy Chicken 15 Ratings Blackened Ranch Pan-Fried Chicken Thighs 15 Ratings Simple Broiled Chicken Breasts 1 Rating Easy Baked Chicken Tenders 75 Ratings Lucky's Quickie Chickie 291 Ratings Lighter Chicken Egg Foo Young 11 Ratings Sriracha Honey Chicken 58 Ratings Easy Garlic Ginger Chicken 110 Ratings Easy Pasta Chicken 49 Ratings Apple Honey Glazed Chicken 77 Ratings A Good, Easy Garlic Chicken 1,761 Ratings Lemon Thyme Chicken Tenders 105 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
